New Records: David Warner joined Ross Taylor and Virat Kohli as the only players to have reached 100 internationals in each format.
Key Match Events: West Indies were on track with openers Brandon King and Johnson Charles smashing a half-century partnership inside four overs
Adam Zampa bowled superbly in the middle-overs to outfox an ultra-aggressive West Indies, who fell short
Pre-Game Insights: The three-match series effectively starts T20 World Cup preparations for both teams
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies' seamers took the pace off in the backend with slower balls accounting for several wickets as Australia's big-hitters attempted to clear the ground
West Indies' strategy of relying on slower deliveries seems fraught with danger on harder Australian pitches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia dominated the bookends in an equal-record T20I score in Hobart
Others: Australia's frontline pace attack is obviously settled, but intrigue surrounds which other quicks will be selected for the World Cup
